Abstract: Understanding the intricate mechanisms of gene regulation necessitates a detailed examination of transcription factor (TF) dynamics at the single-molecule level. This study delves into the behavior of TFs within the complex milieu of the cell nucleus, employing cutting-edge single-molecule tracking techniques to unravel the temporal and spatial dynamics of these pivotal regulatory molecules. By focusing on transcriptional bursting, a phenomenon characterized by intermittent periods of gene activity, we aim to elucidate the stochastic nature of gene expression and its implications for cellular function. Furthermore, this research explores the interplay between TF dynamics, genome organization, and chromatin dynamics, shedding light on how these elements collectively orchestrate the precise regulation of gene expression. Our findings contribute to a deeper understanding of the molecular underpinnings of gene regulation, offering insights into the fundamental processes that govern cellular identity and function.
